items.sentence: Tom's job is to help people find a suitable pet.
I've decided to study French instead of English.
I've decided to go to Boston instead of Chicago.
Would you please fax the application form to me?
Can you recommend a good restaurant around here?
How many pieces of luggage will you be checking?
Are you sure you want to start doing that today?
You're too old to apply for the job, aren't you?
You're way too old to be doing this, aren't you?
I don't think that I've ever seen Tom with Mary.
I don't think that I could do what Tom is doing.
I don't think that Tom has to do that right now.
What other cities in Australia have you been to?
I suspect that Tom has been drinking on the job.
If you want a drink, you can buy one over there.
Tom ordered Mary a drink with an umbrella in it.
I had no idea how much fun this was going to be.
Tom was one of the three who died in the attack.
Tell Tom that I'm not going to do that with him.
Tom told me he doesn't really care what happens.
